00020 /*******************************************************************************
00021 
00022   sc_runnable_int.h -- For inline definitions of some utility functions.
00023                        DO NOT EXPORT THIS INCLUDE FILE. Include this file
00024                        after "sc_process_int.h" so that we can get the base
00025                        class right.
00026 
00027   Original Author: Bishnupriya Bhattacharya , Cadence Design, 28th July, 2003
00028 
00029  CHANGE LOG AT THE END OF THE FILE

00032 #ifndef SC_RUNNABLE_INT_H
00033 #define SC_RUNNABLE_INT_H
00034 
00035 
00036 #include "sysc/kernel/sc_runnable.h"
00037 #include "sysc/kernel/sc_method_process.h"
00038 #include "sysc/kernel/sc_thread_process.h"
00039 
00040 // DEBUGGING MACROS:
00041 //
00042 // DEBUG_MSG(NAME,P,MSG)
00043 //     MSG  = message to print
00044 //     NAME = name that must match the process for the message to print, or
00045 //            null if the message should be printed unconditionally.
00046 //     P    = pointer to process message is for, or NULL in which case the
00047 //            message will not print.
00048 #if 0
00049 #   include <cstring>
00050 #   define DEBUG_NAME ""
00051 #   define DEBUG_MSG(NAME,P,MSG) \
00052     { \
00053         if ( P && ( (std::strlen(NAME)==0) || !std::strcmp(NAME,P->name())) ) \
00054           std::cout << "**** " << sc_time_stamp() << " ("  \
00055                     << sc_get_current_process_name("** NONE **") << "): " << MSG \
00056                     << " - " << P->name() << std::endl; \
00057     }
00058 #else
00059 #   define DEBUG_MSG(NAME,P,MSG) 
00060 #endif
00061 
00062 namespace sc_core {
00063 
00064 // The values below are used to indicate when a queue is empty. A non-zero     
00065 // non-legal pointer value is used for this so that a zero value in the
00066 // m_execute_p field of an sc_process_b instance can be used to indicate      
00067 // that is has not been queued for run. (If we did not use a non-zero
00068 // queue empty indicator then a sc_process_b instance that was queued
00069 // twice in a row might end up on the queue twice if it were the first
00070 // one that was queued!)
00071 
00072 #define SC_NO_METHODS ((sc_method_handle)0xdb)
00073 #define SC_NO_THREADS ((sc_thread_handle)0xdb)
00074 
00075 
00076 //------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00077 //"sc_runnable::dump"
00078 //
00079 // This method dumps the contents of this object instance.
00080 //------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00081 inline void sc_runnable::dump() const
00082 {
00083     // Dump the thread queues:
00084 
00085     std::cout << "thread pop queue: " << std::endl;
00086     for ( sc_thread_handle p = m_threads_pop; p != SC_NO_THREADS; 
00087           p = p->next_runnable() )
00088     {
00089         std::cout << "    " << p << std::endl;
00090     }
00091 
00092     std::cout << "thread push queue: " << std::endl;
00093     for ( sc_thread_handle p = m_threads_push_head->next_runnable(); 
00094           p != SC_NO_THREADS; p = p->next_runnable() )
00095     {
00096         std::cout << "    " << p << std::endl;
00097     }
00098 }
00099 
00100 //------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00101 //"sc_runnable::execute_method_next"
00102 //
00103 // This method pushes the the supplied method to execute as the next process.
00104 // This is done by pushing it onto the front of the m_methods_pop.
00105 //     method_h -> method process to add to the queue.
00106 //------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00107 inline void sc_runnable::execute_method_next( sc_method_handle method_h )
00108 {
00109     DEBUG_MSG(DEBUG_NAME,method_h,"pushing this method to execute next");
00110     method_h->set_next_runnable( m_methods_pop );
00111     m_methods_pop = method_h;
00112 }
00113 
00114 //------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00115 //"sc_runnable::execute_thread_next"
00116 //
00117 // This method pushes the the supplied thread to execute as the next process.
00118 // This is done by pushing it onto the front of the m_threads_pop.
00119 //     thread_h -> thread process to add to the queue.
00120 //------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00121 inline void sc_runnable::execute_thread_next( sc_thread_handle thread_h )
00122 {
00123     DEBUG_MSG(DEBUG_NAME,thread_h,"pushing this thread to execute next");
00124     thread_h->set_next_runnable( m_threads_pop );
00125     m_threads_pop = thread_h;
00126 }
00127 
00128 //------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00129 //"sc_runnable::init"
00130 //
00131 // This method initializes this object instance. Note we allocate the queue
00132 // heads if necessary. This is done here rather than in the constructor for
00133 // this class to eliminate CTOR processing errors with gcc.
00134 //------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00135 inline void sc_runnable::init()
00136 {
00137     m_methods_pop = SC_NO_METHODS;
00138     if ( !m_methods_push_head )
00139     {
00140         m_methods_push_head = new sc_method_process("methods_push_head", true, 
00141                                                    (SC_ENTRY_FUNC)0, 0, 0);
00142         m_methods_push_head->dont_initialize(true);
00143         m_methods_push_head->detach();
00144     }
00145     m_methods_push_tail = m_methods_push_head;
00146     m_methods_push_head->set_next_runnable(SC_NO_METHODS);
00147 
00148     m_threads_pop = SC_NO_THREADS;
00149     if ( !m_threads_push_head )
00150     {
00151         m_threads_push_head = new sc_thread_process("threads_push_head", true, 
00152                                                     (SC_ENTRY_FUNC)0, 0, 0);
00153         m_threads_push_head->dont_initialize(true);
00154         m_threads_push_head->detach();
00155     }
00156     m_threads_push_head->set_next_runnable(SC_NO_THREADS);
00157     m_threads_push_tail = m_threads_push_head;
00158 }
00159 
00160 
00161 //------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00162 //"sc_runnable::is_empty"
00163 //
00164 // This method returns true if the push queue is empty, or false if not.
00165 //------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00166 inline bool sc_runnable::is_empty() const
00167 {
00168     return m_methods_push_head->next_runnable() == SC_NO_METHODS && 
00169            m_methods_pop == SC_NO_METHODS &&
00170            m_threads_push_head->next_runnable() == SC_NO_THREADS &&
00171            m_threads_pop == SC_NO_THREADS;
00172 }
00173 
00174 
00175 //------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00176 //"sc_runnable::is_initialized"
00177 //
00178 // This method returns true if the push queue is already initialized.
00179 //------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00180 inline bool sc_runnable::is_initialized() const
00181 {
00182     return m_methods_push_head && m_threads_push_head;
00183 }
00184 
00185 
00186 //------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00187 //"sc_runnable::push_back_method"
00188 //
00189 // This method pushes the supplied method process onto the back of the queue of 
00190 // runnable method processes.
00191 //     method_h -> method process to add to the queue.
00192 //------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00193 inline void sc_runnable::push_back_method( sc_method_handle method_h )
00194 {
00195     // sc_assert( method_h->next_runnable() == 0 ); // Can't queue twice.
00196     DEBUG_MSG(DEBUG_NAME,method_h,"pushing back method");
00197     method_h->set_next_runnable(SC_NO_METHODS);
00198     m_methods_push_tail->set_next_runnable(method_h);
00199     m_methods_push_tail = method_h;
00200 }
00201 
00202 
00203 //------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00204 //"sc_runnable::push_back_thread"
00205 //
00206 // This method pushes the supplied thread process onto the back of the queue of 
00207 // runnable thread processes.
00208 //     thread_h -> thread process to add to the queue.
00209 //------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00210 inline void sc_runnable::push_back_thread( sc_thread_handle thread_h )
00211 {
00212     // sc_assert( thread_h->next_runnable() == 0 ); // Can't queue twice.
00213     DEBUG_MSG(DEBUG_NAME,thread_h,"pushing back thread");
00214     thread_h->set_next_runnable(SC_NO_THREADS);
00215     m_threads_push_tail->set_next_runnable(thread_h);
00216     m_threads_push_tail = thread_h;
00217 }
00218 
00219 
00220 //------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00221 //"sc_runnable::push_front_method"
00222 //
00223 // This method pushes the supplied method process onto the front of the queue of
00224 // runnable method processes. If the queue is empty the process is the tail 
00225 // also.
00226 //     method_h -> method process to add to the queue.
00227 //------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00228 inline void sc_runnable::push_front_method( sc_method_handle method_h )
00229 {
00230     // sc_assert( method_h->next_runnable() == 0 ); // Can't queue twice.
00231     DEBUG_MSG(DEBUG_NAME,method_h,"pushing front method");
00232     method_h->set_next_runnable(m_methods_push_head->next_runnable());
00233     if ( m_methods_push_tail == m_methods_push_head ) // Empty queue.
00234     {
00235         m_methods_push_tail->set_next_runnable(method_h);
00236         m_methods_push_tail = method_h;
00237     }
00238     else                                               // Non-empty queue.
00239     {
00240         m_methods_push_head->set_next_runnable(method_h);
00241     }
00242 }
00243 
00244 
00245 //------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00246 //"sc_runnable::push_front_thread"
00247 //
00248 // This method pushes the supplied thread process onto the front of the queue of
00249 // runnable thread processes. If the queue is empty the process is the tail 
00250 // also.
00251 //     thread_h -> thread process to add to the queue.
00252 //------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00253 inline void sc_runnable::push_front_thread( sc_thread_handle thread_h )
00254 {
00255     // sc_assert( thread_h->next_runnable() == 0 ); // Can't queue twice.
00256     DEBUG_MSG(DEBUG_NAME,thread_h,"pushing front thread");
00257     thread_h->set_next_runnable(m_threads_push_head->next_runnable());
00258     if ( m_threads_push_tail == m_threads_push_head ) // Empty queue.
00259     {
00260         m_threads_push_tail->set_next_runnable(thread_h);
00261         m_threads_push_tail = thread_h;
00262     }
00263     else                                               // Non-empty queue.
00264     {
00265         m_threads_push_head->set_next_runnable(thread_h);
00266     }
00267 }
00268 
00269 //------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00270 //"sc_runnable::pop_method"
00271 //
00272 // This method pops the next method process to be executed, or returns a null 
00273 // if no method processes are available for execution.
00274 //------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00275 inline sc_method_handle sc_runnable::pop_method()
00276 {
00277     sc_method_handle result_p;
00278 
00279     result_p = m_methods_pop;
00280     if ( result_p != SC_NO_METHODS ) 
00281     {
00282         m_methods_pop = result_p->next_runnable();
00283         result_p->set_next_runnable(0);
00284     }
00285     else
00286     {
00287         result_p = 0;
00288     }
00289     DEBUG_MSG(DEBUG_NAME,result_p,"popping method");
00290     return result_p;
00291 
00292 }
00293 
00294 //------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00295 //"sc_runnable::pop_thread"
00296 //
00297 // This method pops the next thread process to be executed, or returns a null 
00298 // if no thread processes are available for execution.
00299 //------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00300 inline sc_thread_handle sc_runnable::pop_thread()
00301 {
00302     sc_thread_handle result_p;
00303 
00304     result_p = m_threads_pop;
00305     if ( result_p != SC_NO_THREADS ) 
00306     {
00307         m_threads_pop = result_p->next_runnable();
00308         result_p->set_next_runnable(0);
00309     }
00310     else
00311     {
00312             result_p = 0;
00313     }
00314     DEBUG_MSG(DEBUG_NAME,result_p,"popping thread for execution");
00315     return result_p;
00316 }
00317 
00318 
00319 //------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00320 //"sc_runnable::remove_method"
00321 //
00322 // This method removes the supplied method process from the push queue if it is
00323 // present. Note we clear the method's next pointer so that it may be queued 
00324 // again.
00325 //     remove_p -> method process to remove from the run queue.
00326 //------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00327 inline void sc_runnable::remove_method( sc_method_handle remove_p )
00328 {
00329     sc_method_handle now_p;     // Method now checking.
00330     sc_method_handle prior_p;   // Method prior to now_p.
00331 
00332     // Don't try to remove things if we have not been initialized.
00333 
00334     if ( !is_initialized() ) return;
00335 
00336     // Search the push queue:
00337 
00338     prior_p = m_methods_push_head;
00339     for ( now_p = m_methods_push_head; now_p!= SC_NO_METHODS; 
00340             now_p = now_p->next_runnable() )
00341     {
00342         if ( remove_p == now_p )
00343         {
00344             prior_p->set_next_runnable( now_p->next_runnable() );
00345             if (now_p == m_methods_push_tail) {
00346                 m_methods_push_tail = prior_p;
00347             }
00348             now_p->set_next_runnable(0);
00349             DEBUG_MSG(DEBUG_NAME,now_p,"removing method from push queue");
00350             return;
00351         }
00352         prior_p = now_p;
00353     }
00354 
00355     // Search the pop queue:
00356 
00357     prior_p = NULL;
00358     for ( now_p = m_methods_pop; now_p != SC_NO_METHODS; 
00359           now_p = now_p->next_runnable() )
00360     {
00361         if ( remove_p == now_p )
00362         {
00363             if ( prior_p )
00364                 prior_p->set_next_runnable( now_p->next_runnable() );
00365             else
00366                 m_methods_pop = now_p->next_runnable();
00367             now_p->set_next_runnable(0);
00368             DEBUG_MSG(DEBUG_NAME,now_p,"removing method from pop queue");
00369             return;
00370         }
00371         prior_p = now_p;
00372     }
00373 }
00374 
00375 
00376 //------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00377 //"sc_runnable::remove_thread"
00378 //
00379 // This method removes the supplied thread process from the push or pop
00380 // queue if it is present. Note we clear the thread's next pointer so that it 
00381 // may be queued again.
00382 //     remove_p -> thread process to remove from the run queue.
00383 //------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00384 inline void sc_runnable::remove_thread( sc_thread_handle remove_p )
00385 {
00386     sc_thread_handle now_p;     // Thread now checking.
00387     sc_thread_handle prior_p;   // Thread prior to now_p.
00388 
00389     // Don't try to remove things if we have not been initialized.
00390 
00391     if ( !is_initialized() ) return;
00392 
00393     // Search the push queue:
00394 
00395     prior_p = m_threads_push_head;
00396     for ( now_p = m_threads_push_head; now_p != SC_NO_THREADS; 
00397           now_p = now_p->next_runnable() )
00398     {
00399         if ( remove_p == now_p )
00400         {
00401             prior_p->set_next_runnable( now_p->next_runnable() );
00402             if (now_p == m_threads_push_tail) {
00403                 m_threads_push_tail = prior_p;
00404             }
00405             now_p->set_next_runnable(0);
00406             DEBUG_MSG(DEBUG_NAME,now_p,"removing thread from push queue");
00407             return;
00408         }
00409         prior_p = now_p;
00410     }
00411 
00412     // Search the pop queue:
00413 
00414     prior_p = NULL;
00415     for ( now_p = m_threads_pop; now_p != SC_NO_THREADS; 
00416           now_p = now_p->next_runnable() )
00417     {
00418         if ( remove_p == now_p )
00419         {
00420             if ( prior_p )
00421                 prior_p->set_next_runnable( now_p->next_runnable() );
00422             else
00423                 m_threads_pop = now_p->next_runnable();
00424             now_p->set_next_runnable(0);
00425             DEBUG_MSG(DEBUG_NAME,now_p,"removing thread from pop queue");
00426             return;
00427         }
00428         prior_p = now_p;
00429     }
00430 }
00431 
00432 //------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00433 //"sc_runnable::sc_runnable"
00434 //
00435 // This is the object instance constructor for this class.
00436 //------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00437 inline sc_runnable::sc_runnable() : 
00438    m_methods_push_head(0), m_methods_push_tail(0), m_methods_pop(SC_NO_METHODS),
00439    m_threads_push_head(0), m_threads_push_tail(0), m_threads_pop(SC_NO_THREADS)
00440 {}
00441 
00442 //------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00443 //"sc_runnable::~sc_runnable"
00444 //
00445 // This is the object instance destructor for this class.
00446 //------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00447 inline sc_runnable::~sc_runnable()
00448 {
00449     delete m_methods_push_head;
00450     delete m_threads_push_head;
00451 }
00452 
00453 
00454 //------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00455 //"sc_runnable::toggle_methods"
00456 //
00457 // This method moves the methods push queue to the pop queue and zeros the push
00458 // queue. This will only be done if the pop queue is presently empty.
00459 //------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00460 inline void sc_runnable::toggle_methods()
00461 {
00462     if ( m_methods_pop == SC_NO_METHODS )
00463     {
00464         m_methods_pop = m_methods_push_head->next_runnable();
00465         m_methods_push_head->set_next_runnable(SC_NO_METHODS);
00466         m_methods_push_tail = m_methods_push_head;
00467     }
00468 }
00469 
00470 
00471 //------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00472 //"sc_runnable::toggle_threads"
00473 //
00474 // This method moves the threads push queue to the pop queue and zeros the push
00475 // queue. This will only be done if the pop queue is presently empty.
00476 //------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00477 inline void sc_runnable::toggle_threads()
00478 {
00479     if ( m_threads_pop == SC_NO_THREADS )
00480     {
00481         m_threads_pop = m_threads_push_head->next_runnable();
00482         m_threads_push_head->set_next_runnable(SC_NO_THREADS);
00483         m_threads_push_tail = m_threads_push_head;
00484     }
00485 }
00486 
00487 #undef SC_NO_METHODS
00488 #undef SC_NO_THREADS
00489 #undef DEBUG_MSG
00490 
00491 } // namespace sc_core
